content:
OUT! LBW! That ends the match as Hasaranga finishes with 4 scalps. Full, outside off, another googly, Jaker Ali gets down to sweep but misses and is hit on the pads. Hasaranga appeals and the umpire agrees. Jaker wants a review but there is none left. BANGLADESH BOWLED OUT FOR 167 AND SRI LANKA WIN BY 77 RUNS!
Jaker Ali lbw W Hasaranga 51 (64b 4x4 4x6)
Full, around middle and leg, Jaker defends it to the leg side.
Full and around off, stabbed into the cover region.
Outside off, pushed to the off side.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Jaker Ali watches it through and blocks it out.

Nothing much on the Free Hit! Someone needs to tell the slip fielder that it is a Free Hit as he starts celebrating. Maheesh Theekshana fires this one full and on middle, Mustafizur Rahman clears his front leg to slog it but misses as the ball crashes onto the stumps.

Flatter, short and on leg, Mustafizur Rahman fails to flick it away and gets hit high on the pads. There is a slight appeal for LBW, but turned down. It would not have mattered anyway, as the siren goes off here. Theekshana has overstepped here. It is a No Ball. Free Hit up next.
Quicker one, full and on leg, Jaker Ali clips it through square leg for a single.

FOUR! FIFTY FOR ALI! His third ODI half-century and he is standing as the lone warrior for Bangladesh. Flighted, full and around off, Jaker Ali has a wild swing across the line. Gets an outisde edge that flies well past short third for a boundary.
Darts in a yorker now, on leg, Jaker Ali backs away and digs it out to the right of the bowler.
Tries the wrong'un, short and around off, Jaker Ali punches it to sweeper cover but refuses the single.

In the air ... safe again! Tossed up, full and on middle, Jaker Ali tries to slog it across the line but loses his bottom hand in the process. He mistimes it in the air but the ball lands well in front of deep mid-wicket.
Flighted, full and on middle, Mustafizur Rahman defends it on the front foot.
A googly, short and on middle, turns in, Jaker Ali gets a bit cramped up but pats it to the leg side for a quick single.
FOUR! Good shot! Flatter delivery, full and just on off. Jaker Ali goes down across and executes the sweep nicely through square leg for a boundary. Bangladesh need 90 runs in 98 balls now!
Slows it up, dragged back and on off, turns away too, Jaker Ali steers it away but straight towards short third.
Floated, full and around off, Jaker Ali pushes it to covers.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Jaker Ali fends it off the inner half of the bat to the leg side.
Flighted, full and on middle, Mustafizur Rahman blocks it out solidly. At the same stage, Sri Lanka were 156/5. Not much difference in runs, but massive difference in the wickets column.
Arm ball, short and on off, angling in, Mustafizur Rahman stays back and keeps it out.
Goes short and on off, Jaker Ali tries to muscle it away but gets it from the inside half of the bat towards deep mid-wicket for a single.
Quicker, shortish and on off, Jaker Ali opens the face of his bat and guides it away but find short third.
Floated, full and around off, Jaker Ali reaches out and drills it to mid off.
Flatter, full and well outside off, Jaker Ali backs away and leaves it thinking it is a wide, but it is inisde the guideline.

Almost! Asitha Fernando bangs in a quick and sharp bouncer, on middle, angling in. Mustafizur Rahman tries to sway away from it but keeps his bat hanging out. The ball takes the outisde edge but lands safely in the vacant short third region.
Right in the blockhole, just around off, Mustafizur Rahman digs it out towards mid off.
Pitched up and on middle, Jaker Ali works it through mid-wicket for a single. 150 up for Bangladesh!
Slower one, hard length and on off, Jaker Ali punches it to covers.

SIX! INTO THE STANDS! Jaker Ali is not going down without a fight here! Short of a length and on middle. Ali pounces on it quickly, swivels and hammers it over the deep square leg fence for a biggie. Bangladesh needs 96 runs in 112 balls now!

FOUR! A bit sloppy in the field! Asitha Fernando starts this spell with a  fuller one and on off, Jaker Ali stays deep in his crease and drills it hard and wide of mid off. Charith Asalanka runs to his left but dives over the ball to let it through for a boundary.
Slower through the air, short and on leg, Mustafizur Rahman misses his flick and gets hit high on the body. A slight appeal for LBW, but turned down.
Short again and outisde off, Jaker Ali punches it through extra covers for a single.
Floated, full and well outside off, Jaker Ali backs away a bit too much and fails to reach it.
Flatter, short and on middle, Jaker Ali steers it to point.

SIX! Clears the fence! Flighted, full and on middle, Jaker Ali goes down on one knee and slogs it but once again mistimes it high in the air. However, he generates enough power for it to sail over the long on fence for a biggie.

JUST SHORT! Tossed up, full and on middle and off, Jaker Ali slogs it aerially down the ground, does not get the elevation as it goes flat towards long on. The fielder runs in and dives but the ball drops well short of him. He does well to get his body behind to stop the boundary.
Fizz survives! Flatter, full and on middle, Mustafizur Rahman keeps it out well.
Play and a miss! Slower through the air, full and outisde off, Mustafizur Rahman plays inside the line of it and the ball goes through to the keeper.
Flighted, full and around off, Jaker Ali swipes it to deep mid-wicket for a single. Fizz has two balls to survive.
SIX! BOOM! Connects well this time! Flighted, full and on leg, Jaker Ali dances down the track and muscles it over the deep mid-wicket fence for a biggie.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Jaker Ali uses his feet and drills it to long on but does not take the single.
Floated, full and on middle, Jaker Ali blocks it out.
Fires one full and on leg, Mustafizur Rahman fends it off the inner half of the bat to square leg.

Another appeal for caught behind, but turned down! Short and wide outside off again, Mustafizur Rahman stays back to punch it away but misses. Kusal Mendis grabs it and thinks there is an edge but they do not go for the review.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE! Tanvir Islam fails to survive and Maheesh Theekshana gets his first wicket now. He bowls this quicker, short and outside off, angling away too. Islam backs away a bit and tries to cut it away but only manages to get a thin outside edge behind where Kusal Mendis takes a sharp catch. Bangladesh are 123/9 now, still needing 120 runs in 128 balls. Sri Lanka just one wicket away!
Tanvir Islam c K Mendis b M Theekshana 5 (19b 1x4 0x6)
Flighted, full and around off, Jaker Ali decides to take it one, goes down and swipes it to deep mid-wicket for a single. He exposes Tanvir Islam for 3 balls of this over.
Floated, full and on middle again, Jaker Ali strides out and fends it away.
Flatter, full and on middle, Jaker Ali blocks it down the pitch.
Another maiden over! Slows it up, full and on middle, Tanvir Islam looks to work it across the line but gets a leading edge along the ground towards point.
Goes short and on middle, Tanvir Islam flicks it away past mid-wicket, but Ali refuses the single.
Loops it up, full and on off, Tanvir Islam prods forward and knocks it back to the bowler.
A googly now, full and on leg, turns away, Tanvir Islam keeps it out to the off side.
Floated, full and on middle, Tanvir Islam strides out and blocks it out.
Tossed up, full and on off, Tanvir Islam drives it to mid off.

FOUR! Gets it right this time! Flatter, full and down the leg side, Jaker Ali gets on one knee and swipes it to the vacant deep backward square leg fence for a boundary. Bangladesh needs 121 runs in 138 balls.
Tossed up, full and on middle and leg, Jaker Ali goes down to paddle it away but fails to hit it cleanly.
A full toss, on off, Tanvir Islam backs away and drives it wide of long off for a single.
Floated, full and on middle, Tanvir Islam blocks it out this time.
Short and on off, Tanvir Islam punches it to covers.
Swing and a miss! Tossed up, full and around off, Tanvir Islam looks to go for the big slog swep but only connects with thin air.
MAIDEN OVER! Flighted, full and on off, Jaker Ali is solid in his defense. Bangladesh need 126 runs in 144 balls.
Floated, full and on middle again, Jaker Ali defends it on the back foot.
Loopy delivery, full toss, on middle, Jaker Ali prods forward and blocks it close to his pads. Kusal Mendis thinks it is pad first, but nothing from the umpire.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Jaker Ali strides out and dead-bats it.
Slows it up, short again and middle, Jaker Ali defends it onto the pitch.
Shortish and on middle, Jaker Ali stays back and blocks it out.
Flattter, full and around leg, Jaker Ali this time manages to connect and paddles it to fine leg for a single.
Floated, full and on leg, Jaker Ali goes down to paddle it away but misses and gets hit on the pads.
SIX! Gets hold of that one! Loops in a low full toss, on middle. Jaker Ali goes down and reaches out for it before smashing over the deep mid-wicket fence for a biggie.
Shortish, outside off, punched to sweeper cover for a single.
Flighted, on middle, Jaker Ali jumps down the track and hits it towards mid on. Does not take the single.
Flighted, around middle, watchfully defended.
Tossed up, full and on off, Tanvir Islam drives it nicely wide of short covers where the fielder dives to his right to make the stop.
Continues with the shorter length, but slows it up a bit, outisde off, Tanvir Islam steers it away towards point.
Shorter in length again, on middle, Jaker Ali backs away and punches it through covers for a single.
Another googly, outside off, shortish in length, Ali stays back to block.
Another wrong 'un, outside off, Jaker lunges to defend. Picked the line this time.
The googly, outside off, Jaker Ali looks to drive it through the off side but gets a thick inside edge towards short mid-wicket.

FOUR! A poor delivery and rightly punished! Shorter in length and on middle, keeps a bit low too. Tanvir Islam has enough time to rock back and heaves it towards the deep square leg fence for a boundary. Nelson on the board now.
Quicker, short and outside off, Tanvir Islam cuts it straight to point.
Floated, full and on middle and leg, Jaker Ali goes down on the leg side and swipes it towards deep square leg for a single. The fielder fumbles a bit but does not cost much.
Down the leg side, Ali looks to paddle but the keeper stops to his left.
Around off, driven back to the bowler.
Down the leg side, Jaker Ali looks to flick but misses and is hit on the pads.
Flighted, full and on leg, Tanvir Islam clips it towards square leg.
Tossed up, full and on off, Tanvir Islam strides out and keeps it out to the off side.
Fires in a yorker, on middle, Tanvir Islam jams it out towards mid on.
Down the leg side, Jaker helps it towards short fine leg and takes a quick single. There is a mixup but no harm done this time. 139 more needed from 171 balls.
A touch shorter in length, outside off, defended solidly.
Full and outside off, Jaker Ali just dead-bats it towards point.
Slows it up, full and around off, turns away, Tanvir Islam leaves it alone. Just one extra, and two wickets from the over. Superb stuff!

OUT! LBW! Another one bites the dust! Kamindu Mendis gets his second in the over, or does he? Taskin Ahmed takes the review after having a chat with his partner. UltraEdge confirms no bat involved, and Ball Tracking comes up with three reds. OUT it is! Coming to the delivery, Mendis bowls the arm ball, full and on middle, angling in a hit. Taskin strides out to defend but plays down the wrong line and gets hit on the pads. Number eight down for Bangladesh, and Taskin takes a review with himself as well. Sri Lanka just a couple of wicket away from the win now!
Taskin Ahmed lbw K Mendis 0 (3b 0x4 0x6)
Fires one full but down the leg side, Taskin Ahmed misses his flick. Wided.
Flighted, full and on middle, Taskin Ahmed blocks it back to the bowler.
Outside off, this time an off spinner, pushed to the off side.

OUT! CAUGHT! Another stunner and Sanath Jayasuriya in the Lankan dugout is besides himself! Sri Lanka just can't do anything wrong in this last half hour. 6 wickets for 4 runs in the last 24 balls! A full toss, on middle, Tanzim leans and flicks it uppishly through mid-wicket. But Maheesh Theekshana at short mid-wicket leaps to his left and takes a very good catch! Second wicket to Kamindu and this is the 5th wicket to spin in this innings. Tanzim departs for 1 (6) and from 100/1, Bangladesh have slipped down to 104/7! Equation - 141 from 178!
Tanzim Hasan Sakib c M Theekshana b K Mendis 1 (6b 0x4 0x6)
Left-arm spin, from around the wicket, Tanzim Hasan Sakib defends.

Ooohh... full and outside off, Jaker looks to drive but does not pick the googly. The ball spins back in, takes the inside edge and goes to short fine leg! Hasaranga and the umpire - both sport a smile. Just a run and a wicket from the over, Hasaranga's bowling figures read - 2-0-3-3!
Outside off, punched through the covers for a single.
Down the leg side, Tanzim looks to paddle but gets it off the pads to short fine leg.
Around off, pushed back to the bowler.
Full toss, worked through mid on but short mid-wicket dives to his left to stop the ball.

OUT! LBW! The skipper goes too! A googly, outside off, short of full length, Mehidy Hasan Miraz walks across his stumps to flick but misses and is hit on the pads. Hasaranga appeals and the umpire raises his finger. Mehidy takes the review but Ball Tracking shows it to be hitting leg stump! Wicket number 3 for 'Wow'indu and this is the second duck in the innings! From 100/1, Bangladesh have slipped to 103/6 and the equation reads - 142 from 185!
Mehidy Hasan Miraz (c) lbw W Hasaranga 0 (2b 0x4 0x6)

Huge appeal for LBW, turned down! Full, around off, Jaker looks to defend but is squared up and the ball goes off something to short third. He wants a single but is sent back. Now, Sri Lanka believe they have their man and take the review for LBW. The third umpire checks it but on the first replay itself, he is convinced that Jaker has hit it. Rules it not out but Charith Asalanka is not convinced. He wants the third umpire to use technology and UltraEdge detects a spike when the ball is past the bat. Not sure whether the fielding captain can force the umpire to use technology. That's the latter's call. Besides, it was clearly evident from the replay.
Very full, pushed back to the bowler.
Full, around off, well defended.

OUT! BOWLED! Third wicket to spin and Bangladesh are spiralling down here. Landed outside off, Tawhid Hridoy looks to defend but the ball pitches and then spins past in between bat and pad, to hit the timber! Hridoy does not know what has happened. Nor do Bangladesh. From 100/1, they have slipped to 103/5! Equation - 142 from 189. 1 (4) for Hridoy.
Tawhid Hridoy b K Mendis 1 (4b 0x4 0x6)
Very full, around off, jammed towards cover.
Around off, pushed back to the bowler.
WIDE. Down the leg side, Tawhid Hridoy misses his flick.
Full and around off, Mehidy Hasan Miraz pushes it towards mid on. What an over to begin your bowling - 2 runs and 2 wickets - game changer?

OUT! CAUGHT! That is a stunner and this game is wide and truly open! Wow. Does not take long for 101 to follow 100. Full, outside off, Tanzid Hasan looks to hammer this through mid off and for a major part of that event, it seems like the ball is in the gap. But Janith Liyanage races across to his right from mid off and literally flies, taking a terrific two-hander, actually going backwards! Also makes sure that despite the dive and the contact with the ground, the ball did not pop out. Tanzid departs for 62 (61) and from 100/1, Bangladesh have slipped to 102/4! Equation - 143 from 193.
Tanzid Hasan c J Liyanage b W Hasaranga 62 (61b 9x4 1x6)
On middle and leg, tucked straight to mid-wicket.
On middle and leg, worked through the leg side for a single to get off the mark.

OUT! LBW! Sri Lanka overturn the onfield decision! Excellent use of the review. The googly, outside off Litton Das lunged across to defend but missed as the ball spun back in and hit him on the pads. Hasaranga started off on a celebratory run, but the umpire stood firm. Were there two noises? No, says Hasaranga. His skipper and keeper have a chat and Wanindu is convinced this is gone. Asalanka signals the 'T' and UltraEdge returns a flat line, when the ball is close to the bat. Ball Tracking shows it to be hitting leg stump! 100 ODI WICKETS FOR HASARANGA and he is the second quickest Sri Lankan to this milestone! Litton comes and goes for a 4-baller and from 100/1, Bangladesh are now 101/3 in 17.2 overs! Equation - 144 from 196 balls.
Litton Das (wk) lbw W Hasaranga 0 (4b 0x4 0x6)
A touch short to start, around middle and leg, Tanzid Hasan punches this down to long on for a single.
Down the leg side, clipped straight to short mid-wicket. 4 runs and a wicket from the over, Maheesh Theekshana's bowling figures read 5-1-17-0.
A quick short ball, outside off, Litton looks to cut but misses.
Around off, defended solidly.

OUT! NAJMUL HOSSAIN SHANTO IS RUN OUT! What a bonus for Sri Lanka. They were looking down and out and this has come as a blessing to them. A straight delivery, around middle and leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto worked this through square leg and called for two. It seemed like the two was on because it was Shanto's call. But Milan Rathnayake charged onto the ball from deep backward square leg and returned a powerful throw to the keeper, Kusal Mendis. Suspect that Shanto was not expecting the throw to be so accurate and had to step on the accelerator around the midway mark. Towards the end, had to put in the dive and by that time, Kusal seemed to have taken the bails off. The Lankans started to celebrate but the umpire wanted double confirmation and sent it upstairs. The first replay was clear enough to show that Najmul was short, even with the dive but the third umpire took multiple replays before eventually being satisfied. OUT flashes on the giant screen and the crowd roars! The 71-run stand has been broken and Najmul Hossain Shanto departs for 23 (26). Bangladesh are 100/2 and need another 145 from 201 balls!
Najmul Hossain Shanto run out (Milan Rathnayake / Kusal Mendis) 23 (26b 2x4 0x6)
Down the leg side, Tanzid works it through fine leg and races hard to come back for the third.
Maheesh Theekshana is back on. Starts with a length delivery on middle and leg, Tanzid looks to flick but gets a leading edge to cover.

Leading edge, safe! Around off, fuller in length, Tanzid looks to flick but gets a leading edge. However, the ball flies over mid off. The fielder runs back and gets to the ball and pulls it back in. Three runs taken. 149 more needed from 204 balls.
Around off, pushed towards cover.
FOUR! Bad line. A short ball, down the leg side, Tanzid Hasan tucks it to the fine leg fence.
Outside off, pushed towards point for a run.
Landed well outside off, on a yorker length, dabbed towards deep third for a single.
On a length, outside off, Tanzid Hasan punches it towards point.

FIFTY FOR HASAN! A half-century of the highest order! He has looked in sublime touch here and will want to make this a big one now. Coming to the delivery, this is short and outside off, Tanzid Hasan steers it to point for a run.
Much better! Slows it up, full and on middle, Tanzid Hasan defends it on the front foot.
FOUR! Put away! Half-tracker, on middle, begging to be hit, Tanzid Hasan quickly rocks back and smashes it over mid-wicket for a boundary.

RIPPER! Tosses it up, full and on off, grips and turns away sharply. Tanzid Hasan gets drawn forward to defend but the ball just spins past the outside edge. There is definitely some turn on this wicket, but the Lankan bowlers need to hit the right areas consistently.
Floated, full and on middle, Tanzid Hasan pushes it to short covers where the fielder makes a good diving stop.
Flighted, full and outside off, Najmul Hossain Shanto goes down and drags his sweep through square leg for a single.
Uppish but safe! Hard length and just around off, Tanzid Hasan looks to swat it away but checks his shot at the last moment. He hits it aerially but well wide of the bowler and towards mid on.
Bangs this into the pitch and on middle and off, Najmul Hossain Shanto plays a slap-pull through mid-wicket for one.
Back of a length and on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto hops up and bunts it on the pitch. The bounce takes it over the bowler, but Maheesh Theekshana cuts it out at mid on.
Slower one, full and on middle, Tanzid Hasan knocks it towards mid on for another run.
Good length and around off, Najmul Hossain Shanto opens the face of his bat and guides it to third man for a run. That brings up the 50-RUN STAND between these two batters in 52 BALLS.
Short of a length and outisde off, Tanzid Hasan cuts it away through point for a single.
Short and on off, Tanzid Hasan stabs it towards point for one more.
Looped up, full and around off, Najmul Hossain Shanto looks to go for the drive but gets an inside edge towards square leg for one.
Nicely bowled! Slower through the air, full and on off, turns away sharply, Najmul Hossain Shanto plays well inside the line of it and lets it go to the keeper.

In the air...safe! Flighted, full and on middle, turns away a bit. Tanzid Hasan goes down for the slog sweep but gets a bit of a top edge. The ball flies towards deep mid-wicket but lands well in front of the fielder. Asalanka is not happy with the effort, as he thinks the fielder could have made an effort for the catch.
Floated, full and on leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto clips it through square leg for a single.

A huge shout for LBW, but turned down! Charith Asalanka has a long chat with his keeper, Kusal Mendis and decides not to go for the review. This is tossed up, full and on middle and off. Najmul Hossain Shanto goes down across to paddle it away but misses and gets hit on the pads. Probably impact is outside off!
Much fuller and around off, Tanzid Hasan strides out and drives firmly but straight to extra covers. Eshan Malinga's first over yields 9 runs.
Hits the length hard and just outisde off, Tanzid Hasan dabs it to point.
Too full and too straight, Tanzid Hasan clips it away using his wrists through mid-wicket for a couple of more runs.
Good length but around the hip off the batter, Tanzid Hasan flicks it away easily wide of deep square leg for a brace.

FOUR! Fine shot! Short of a length and around middle. Tanzid Hasan picks up the length early, gets on top of it and pulls it with disdain towards the deep square leg fence for a boundary. He moves to 37 off 37 now.
Eshan Malinga starts with a back-of-a-length delivery, on off. It hits Najmul Hossain Shanto's bat hard as he runs it down to deep third for a single.
Quicker, full and on middle, keeps a bit low, Najmul Hossain Shanto adjusts well and flicks it through square leg for one.
TURN AND BOUNCE! Charith Asalanka gives this one some more air, full and around off, grips and turns away with bounce. Najmul Hossain Shanto gets squared up and withdraws his bat at the last moment.
Flighted, full and on middle, Tanzid Hasan works it towards long on for a run.
Oh..beauty! Arm ball, shortish and on off, goes in with the arm sharply, Tanzid Hasan stays back to push it away but misses it completely.

Floated, full and on off, Najmul Hossain Shanto goes down across and drags his sweep towards deep square leg for a single. Shanto wants the second but his partner sends him back. Shanto is not happy and says it is his call.
Tosses it up, full and on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto steps across a bit and clips it to short mid-wicket.
Floats it up, full and on middle, Tanzid Hasan strides out and knocks it towards mid on.
Short again and on leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto nudges it towards square leg for a run.
Goes short and on off, angling in, Tanzid Hasan pats it to the right of the bowler. Maheesh Theekshana dives to that side, gets a hand to it but still lets it through for a single.
Outside off, steered straight to backward point.
Outside off, pushed towards the bowler who stops it in his followthrough.
On middle, worked through mid-wicket for a single.
Slows it up a bit, full and on off, Tanzid Hasan defends it on the front foot.
FOUR! SHORT AND PUNISHED! Charith Asalanka drags his length back and on middle. Tanzid Hasan rocks back quickly and pulls it over mid-wicket for a fine boundary.
Much better line! Floated, short and on middle, Tanzid Hasan moves back and pats it back to the bowler.
Around off, solidly defended.
FOUR! Nicely done. Fractionally short, around middle, Tanzid Hasan gets down and mows the pull-sweep over square leg and gets a boundary!
Full and straight, Najmul Hossain Shanto flicks it towards mid-wicket for a single. 50 UP FOR BANGLADESH, 195 more needed from 251 balls.
Flatter, full and around off, Tanzid Hasan steers it to point.
Five dots in a row now! Goes around the wicket to avoid stepping into the danger area. He drags his length back, on middle, angling in, Tanzid Hasan stays back and keeps it out to the leg side.
Targets the stumps again, fires it full and on middle, Tanzid Hasan blocks it out down the pitch.
Full and straight, Tanzid Hasan defends.
Around middle, pushed towards short mid-wicket again.

On middle and leg, worked towards short mid-wicket. Immediately, the umpire Ruchira Palliyaguruge, ask Theekshana to stay away from the danger area. The replay shows that his right foot was coming near the danger area in the followthrough. What this implies is Theekshana cannot bowl from close to the stumps.
Pitched up but on the pads, Najmul Hossain Shanto flicks it away nicely wide of deep square leg for a brace. 10 runs off this over as well, 20 in the last 2!

FOUR! Shanto is taking the game to the bowlers here! Asitha Fernando goes a bit full and wide outside off. NHS once again charges down the track and tries to loft it away. He ends up slicing it but gets it well over point as it teases the fielder but wins the race to the fence.

FOUR! Gets off the mark with a boundary! Short of a length and on middle and off. Najmul Hossain Shanto uses his feet but stays leg side of the ball. He frees his arms and thumps it past the bowler, through mid on for four runs.
Good tight, accurate bowling. On a length, around middle and off, Najmul defends.
Another one stays low. On a length, outside off, angling away, Shanto looks to cut but the ball stays low a fraction after pitching and goes past the under edge.
Full and straight, Najmul Hossain Shanto defends.
Short of a length and just outside off, Tanzid Hasan stays back and cuts it hard but straight to point. 10 runs off the over!
Touch fuller and on middle and off, Tanzid Hasan knocks it towards mid off.

SIX! PICKED UP AND HOW! Milan Rathnayake bangs this one into the pitch, but it does not bounce that much. Tanzid Hasan gets on top of it in a flash and whacks it nonchalantly over the deep square leg fence for a biggie. 206 more needed from 266 balls.
FOUR! Cracking shot. Short and wide outside off, Tanzid cuts it through point where Kamindu Mendis is a touch lazy in getting to the ball and it slips through.
A short ball, outside off, Tanzid looks to cut but gets a bottom edge towards point.
On a length, around middle and leg, Tanzid Hasan looks to flick but misses and is hit on the pads.
On a good length, outside off, Shanto looks to cut but the ball stays low and beats the outside edge. 4 runs and a wicket from the over, Asitha Fernando's bowling figures read 3-0-17-1!
On a length, around off, pushed to the off side.

OUT! CAUGHT! There goes the first wicket. A total waste. That's the way the new generation plays, not necessarily putting a price tag on their wicket. A short ball, around middle, Emon goes for the pull but the ball skids off the surface and hence, comes on much quicker than his anticipation. Additionally, the ball was angling away from him and hence, the batter had to drag the pull to the leg side. Got a top edge which went straight up in the air. A couple of fielders go for the catch but the keeper, Kusal Mendis calls for it. The ball swirls in the air and he nearly ends up running back and forth, but eventually, takes the catch safely. Parvez Hossain Emon departs for 13 (16) and Bangladesh are 29/1 after 4.4 overs! Equation - 216 from 272.
Parvez Hossain Emon c K Mendis b A Fernando 13 (16b 3x4 0x6)
FOUR! Straight as a dye! Full and straight, Parvez Hossain Emon hits it straight back over the bowler for a boundary down the ground!
This time it is a fuller ball but Emon misses out again. Flicks it straight to short mid-wicket.
On a length, around middle, Parvez Hossain Emon looks to help it away to the leg side but gets a thick inside edge onto his pads.
The arm ball, and I think it was a seam-up delivery. Because it literally swung back into the batter. But Hasan is watchful and defends.
The arm ball, around off, pushed towards point.

FOUR MORE! Change of angle from the bowler but no change in result. Theekshana switches to around the wicket but lands it full and around middle. Tanzid picks it from that length and goes straighter this time, to the right of mid on, but well over his head, for consecutive boundaries!
FOUR! HAMMERED! The carrom ball, around middle, Tanzid Hasan picks it early and swings it over mid on, for a boundary!
Outside off, punched back to the bowler.
Full and straight, defended to the leg side.
Full, around off, defended solidly.
Outside off, punched towards the off side.

Oh dear, that is a hack. On a length, outside off, Tanzid jumps down the track and swings wildly. Is nowhere near the pitch of the ball and gets a top edge which nearly flies down the throat of deep third. The ball lands just in front. A single taken.

FOUR! BEAUTY! On a length, outside off, Tanzid Hasan shows the full face of the bat and just punches it down the ground. Mid off tries to get across to his left but the ball is already past him! 229 more needed from 285 balls.

Plenty of swing but down the leg side. The ball starts from around leg stump but swings further down the leg side, on a fuller length. Emon misses out on the flick and gets hit on the pads. The ball rolls aside down the leg side and the batters take a leg bye.

Full and just around off, 135 kph, Parvez Hossain Emon shows the full face of his bat, gets his head down to where the ball lands, I mean, the eyesight and not literally and meets the ball perfectly, to push it towards point.
Down the leg side, TH works it straight to short mid-wicket.
Another missile, outside off, Hasan looks to cut but misses.
Outside off, punched towards cover.

Nothing much on the Free Hit. Fired in outside off, Emon looks to go over the top but mid off is nearly three-quarters of the way ahead of the ropes. Jogs back a touch and takes the catch but since this is a Free Hit, the catch won't count. A single taken.
Full, around off, Parvez Hossain Emon defends watchfully. Uh oh... the siren goes off which means that Theekshana has overstepped! NO BALL signalled and a Free Hit will follow.

Mixup, but safe. Down the leg side, Tanzid looks to flick but misses. The ball goes off his pads through the vacant leg slip region and Emon calls him through for the single. Tanzid is ball watching and hence, sets off late and in the meanwhile, the fielder from first slip quickly gets to the ball. Fires a throw at the bowler's end but the batter makes it in. Leg bye signalled. Tanzid apologizes to his partner.
Full, on leg stump, from over the wicket, pitches and zips through, Tanzid Hasan defends.
On a length, around off, Parvez Hossain Emon is on the move, while trying to drive and gets a bit of an outside edge towards point.
On a length again, outside off, PHE thrashes that as well, but cannot beat point.

FOUR! Boy o boy, has the dew arrived? Just 4 balls bowled, but already, this pitch is looking like a batting beauty under the lights. On a length, around off, Parvez Hossain Emon comes forward and punches it through the covers. The fielder dives to his left but the ball flies past. 236 more needed from 296 balls.
On a length, outside off, slanting away, Parvez slashes hard but misses.
FOUR! Let's use the phrase again - what a start! This time, for the batter. Overpitched, outside off, Emon leans and drives it between cover and point to begin the innings with a boundary.
What a start! Inswinging yorker straightaway, from off to middle, dipping onto the batter, Parvez Hossain Emon does well to bring his bat down in time to defend.

OUT! ESHAN MALINGA IS RUN OUT! Total chaos to end the innings. A length ball, outside off, Asitha Fernando backs away and slaps it towards mid off. Najmul Hossain Shanto is the fielder over there, who gets across to his left and fires a throw at the bowler's end. Asitha is well short but the throw misses the mark. Asitha then turns around and calls his partner through for the second on the overthrow. But Tawhid Hridoy charges in from square leg and stops the ball before it can go to the deep. Picks the ball up and fires a throw at the bowler's end, to catch Eshan Malinga well short. SRI LANKA HAVE BEEN BOWLED OUT FOR 244!
Eshan Malinga run out (Najmul Hossain Shanto / Tawhid Hridoy) 5 (10b 0x4 0x6)

OUT! CAUGHT! The marathon knock ends at last. Slower ball, fuller on middle, Charith Asalanka looks to whip it over the leg side but cannot quite get underneath the ball. He is early into the shot and mistimes this. Gets it high in the air and Najmul Hossain Shanto charges in from wide long on to take the catch. Asalanka departs for a fantastic 106 (123) and from 226/6, Sri Lanka are 243/9!
Charith Asalanka (c) c NH Shanto b TH Sakib 106 (123b 6x4 4x6)

A quick short ball, around middle and leg, Eshan goes for the pull but is hurried into the shot. There is extra bounce on that ball which makes it go off the glove and in the air but there is no short mid-wicket. Malinga wants the single but is sent back. Excellent returns for Taskin from injury - 10-2-47-4.
Very full, and slow as well, on middle, Asalanka works it through mid on for a single.

Taskin is not happy. A short ball, around middle, Charith Asalanka pulls it through mid-wicket. The plan was to give only a single but the fielder is a bit slow to get to the ball and Asalanka hares back for the second.
Dug in short, around middle, Malinga pulls it to deep mid-wicket and nearly hits it straight to the fielder there. Lands just in front. A single taken.
Excellent yotker, on middle, Eshan Malinga watches it closely and pushes it towards cover. He sets off for a single but the fielder from cover comes in quickly and Malinga is sent back.
On a length, outside off, pushed through the covers for a single. So Asalanka is not farming the strike.
Full, on middle and leg, Asalanka works it through mid-wicket for another single.
A short ball, down the leg side, helped to short fine leg for one more.
On middle and leg, helped straight to short fine leg, for a run.
Outside off, pushed towards cover for a single.

ODI HUNDRED NUMBER 5 FOR CHARITH ASALANKA! What a player. What a skipper. Comes and delivers consistently when the chips are down. Averages 50.54 as a skipper in ODIs and this is his second ton as a captain. Gets there with a gentle push towards cover off a length ball. The bowler gets around to his right and has a shy at the bowler's end but misses, as Asalanka gets the dive in. Gets up, removes the helmet and acknowledges the applause. Now, time to maximize the remaining few balls.
A short ball, down the leg side, Eshan Malinga looks to pull but bottom-edges it to long leg, for a single.

Good work by the fielder. Thrown up, wide outside off, Charith stays leg side of the ball and drives it through the covers. The fielder in the circle dives to his left and takes some sting off the ball, deflecting it closer to the fielder running across to his right from long off. That deflection half stops the ball and enables long off to get around. Two runs taken.

Quicker ball, outside off, Asalanka looks to steer it through point but misses. The bowler keeps on appealing for the caught behind but gets no support from the keeper or the umpire. No reviews left either.
Tossed up, around middle, Eshan drives this through mid on for a single, to get off the mark.
Full and on middle and leg, Malinga lunges to defend and gets a thick inside edge onto his pads. Litton Das appeals for LBW but there was clear bat involved.
A touch short, around middle, Charith Asalanka works it through mid on. Eshan Malinga wants the second but the fielder gets to the ball from mid-wicket and Asalanka sends him back.
Shanto gets the ball again. Full and around off, driven back to the bowler.
A full toss now, but Malinga does not try any heroics. Keeps his head down and firmly defends. 2 runs and 2 wickets from that over. Taskin Ahmed's bowling figures read 9-2-42-4!
On middle and off, well kept out.

OUT! CAUGHT! Second wicket in the over and now, Bangladesh have a serious chance of bowling the Lankans out. The cutter does the trick again. On a length, around off, coming in, Maheesh Theekshana looks to work it to the leg side but is done in by the lack of pace. Is early into the shot and only gets a leading edge, which pops up straight to Jaker Ali at short extra cover. Theekshana comes and goes for 1 (2) and from 226/6, Sri Lanka are now 228/8! Taskin now has 4 wickets as well.
Maheesh Theekshana c J Ali b T Ahmed 1 (2b 0x4 0x6)
On middle and leg, helped through mid-wicket for a run.
A yorker, on off, worked through mid-wicket for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Taskin strikes straightaway in his new spell. On a length, outside off, Wanindu Hasaranga looks to pull but there is no pace on that delivery and the moment it is bowled, Hasaranga's shot comes off the bat, indicating how slowly it was bowled. The ball balloons in the air and long on comes running in a few yards. And it is the substitute fielder, Shamim Hossain. The 34-run stand has been broken and Hasaranga departs for an impressive 22 (22), where he did not just go ball bashing. Sri Lanka are 226/7 after 45.1 overs!
Wanindu Hasaranga c sub Shamim Hossain b Taskin Ahmed 22 (22b 3x4 0x6)

Drags his length back and outside off, Wanindu Hasaranga cuts it away through cover-point for one. Debutant Tanvir Islam, despite struggling with cramps, finishes a good spell of bowling with figures of 10-0-44-1.
Slower through the air, full and on middle, Wanindu Hasaranga is solid in his defense again. Three dots now!
Flatter, full and on off again, Wanindu Hasaranga opens the face of his bat and guides it straight to point.
Arm ball, full and on off, angling in, Wanindu Hasaranga prods forward and blocks it out.
Goes a bit short and on middle, Charith Asalanka clips it off the back foot towards square leg for a run.
Tossed up, full and around off, Wanindu Hasaranga drives it through covers for a single. This partnership is worth 32 off 28 balls now.
Dragged back, on middle, Charith Asalanka rocks back and pulls it away. Does not quite get the timing right but hits it wide of deep mid-wicket to pick up a couple of runs. 10 runs off the over!
Flighted, full and around off, Wanindu Hasaranga winds up for another sweep but sees the line is not right for that shot. He adjusts and drills it to long on for one.
More runs! Short and outside off, Wanindu Hasaranga moves back quickly and cuts it towards the vacant deep point region for a brace.

FOUR! Picks the gap beautifully! Tossed up, full and on middle, in the slot as well. Wanindu Hasaranga gets down on one knee and slog sweeps it nicely between deep mid-wicket and long on for a boundary.
Flatter, short again and on off, Charith Asalanka just guides it to short third for a single.
Floats it up, short and around off, turns away, Charith Asalanka backs away and pats it to short covers.
Another short delivery, on middle, Charith Asalanka stays back and guides it to point for one.
FOUR! ASALANKA INTO THE 90s NOW! Flighted, full and just around off. Charith Asalanka goes down on a knee, extends his arms to reach for it and smacks it over extra covers for a boundary.
Pushed through quicker, full and around off, Wanindu Hasaranga strides out and drives it through covers for a run.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Wanindu Hasaranga pushes it to short covers.
Slows it up, short again and on off, Charith Asalanka waits for it and steers it just wide of short third for a single. He moves to 86 now!
Floated, short and on middle, turns in, Charith Asalanka moves back and pats it to short mid-wicket.
Hard length and on leg, Wanindu Hasaranga glances off his hips and beats the dive of the shot fine fielder to his right. Two taken.

FOUR! Oh..that is a shot and a half! Taskin Ahmed goes for the wide yorker, outside off and executes it too. However, Wanindu Hasaranga is one step forward. He crouches low, opens the face of his bat and squeezes it through backward point for another boundary.
On a length and just around off, Charith Asalanka guides it towards point for a quick run. The fielder misses his shy at the bowler's end, but CA was in anyway. 200 UP FOR SRI LANKA!
Back of a length and on middle, Wanindu Hasaranga heaves it away but this time straight towards deep square leg for just a single.

FOUR! Gets it away! Short of a length and around off at no real pace, begging to be put away. Wanindu Hasaranga obliges, gets on top of the bounce nicely and pulls it to the deep mid-wicket fence for a boundary.
Fuller in length and on off, shapes in a touch, Wanindu Hasaranga pushes it just using his hands towards covers.
Looped up, full and on off, Charith Asalanka works it towards mid on. He is not happy with himself as he wanted to keep the strike.
A bit short this time, on middle, Charith Asalanka stays back and nudges it to mid-wicket.
Good shot but just for one! Flighted, full and middle, Wanindu Hasaranga goes inside out and lofts it. He wants to go over extra cover but hits it much straighter and wide of long off. They cross.
Slower through the air, full and on off, Wanindu Hasaranga watches it through and knocks it to covers again.
Floated, full and on middle, turns away again, Wanindu Hasaranga pushes it to covers.
Huge turn! Tossed up, full and around off, grips and turns in a long way. Charith Asalanka gets cramped up and just manages to tuck it away with one hand towards square leg. A single taken.
Worked towards short mid-wicket.

Oh...fiery! Tanzim Hasan Sakib bangs in a quick and sharp bouncer, on middle, takes off viciously. Wanindu Hasaranga stays in his crease and tries to defend it but takes his eyes off the ball. He gets hit on his gloves just in front of the helmet.
Back of a length and on middle and off, Wanindu Hasaranga keeps it out to the off side.

OUT! DRAGGED ON, BOWLED! Tanzim Hasan Sakib breaks the 39-run stand but this dismissal should worry Bangladesh. On a length, around off, the off cutter, Milan Rathnayake looks to steer it towards deep third but the ball stays low. Takes the bottom edge and goes onto hit the stumps. If there is no dew in the second innings, this might be trouble for the visitors. Rathnayake departs for 22 (31) and Sri Lanka are 192/6 after 39.3 overs!
Milan Rathnayake b TH Sakib 22 (31b 3x4 0x6)
Good comeback by the bowler. On a length, outside off, Rathnayake looks to steer it towards deep third but is beaten by the lack of pace.
FOUR! AWESOME! Overpitched, outside off, Milan Rathnayake comes forward and drives it beautifully between cover and mid off. The latter tries to run after the ball but comes second.
Drags his length back, on leg, Milan Rathnayake stays back and clips it to square leg for one.
FOUR! Fine use of the feet! Floated, full and around off, Milan Rathnayake skips down the track and smacks it over mid off for a boundary.
Sees the batter advance and drags his length back, on middle, Milan Rathnayake gets a bit cramped up and only manages to work it to square leg.

Excellent effort by Tawhid Hridoy. Down the leg side, Rathnayake goes back and nudges it through fine leg. The ball races away towards the ropes but Hridoy charges to his left from deep backward square leg and dives to stop the ball, Manages to pull the ball in and saves a couple of runs for his side.
On middle and leg, nudged to the leg side.

In the air... safe! Landed outside off, Charith Asalanka backs away to the leg side and looks to go inside out but ends up skewing it. The ball takes the outside edge and lands behind point. A single taken.
Short of a length and on off, Milan Rathnayake rides the bounce and punches it to wide of mid off.
Gets away with it! Low full toss and on the pads, Charith Asalanka can hit it anywhere he likes, but ends up flicking it straight towards deep square leg for just one.
A slower one now, full and on off, Charith Asalanka drives it towards short covers.
Another short ball, helped over square leg for a couple this time.
Another short ball, Milan Rathnayake pulls it through mid-wicket for a run.
A short ball, around off, pulled through mid-wicket for a single.
Dragged back again, on middle and off, Milan Rathnayake goes on the back foot and punches it straight to extra covers.
Floated, short and on middle, Milan Rathnayake moves back and pats it back to the bowler.
Tossed up, full and around off, Charith Asalanka strides out and drives to sweeper covers for another run.
Down the leg side, helped through square leg for a run.
Outside off, driven through the covers for a single.
Full, outside off, pushed towards point.
A bit fuller, on middle, Milan Rathnayake stays back and blocks it out.
Bangs this into the pitch, outside off, takes pace and this angles away too. Milan Rathnayake has a slash at it but misses.
Back of a length and on middle, Charith Asalanka pulls it away to deep mid-wicket for a run.
On a good length, outside off, Rathnayake opens the face of his bat and guides it behind point for a single.
Similar ball, defended solidly.
On a good length, around middle and leg, Milan Rathnayake defends.
Outside off, pushed towards cover.
A short ball, outside off, Asalanka looks to cut but gets a bottom edge towards point.
Quicker ball, outside off, stabbed to the off side.
Landed outside off, a touch slow, pushed towards point.
Full and around off, solidly defended.
Outside off, punched back to the bowler. He fumbles and allows a single to long off.
Landed outside off, bit of turn away, Milan goes back and punches it through the covers for a run.
Full, on middle, a little bit of drift into the left hander, Rathnayake flicks it straight to short mid-wicket.
Around off, solidly defended.
Full, around off, pushed back to the bowler.
FOUR! FETCH THAT! Dropped short, around off, Rathnayake rocks back and pulls it over mid-wicket for a boundary!
Nothing much on the Free Hit. Thrown wide outside off, Asalanka leans and drives it through the covers for just a single.
NO BALL, SIX! A high full toss, around middle, Charith Asalanka goes back and pulls it over mid-wicket! The umpires give it a no ball for height as well.
Turn and bounce now! Outside off, Rathnayake looks to defend but the ball pitches and spins past the outside edge.

DROPPED? Nope. A touch short of full, outside off, Milan Rathnayake looked to push it back and nearly scooped a return catch. The ball though, landed just in front of the bowler as he dived to his right.
Full, outside off, pushed through cover for a run.
On middle and off, punched down to long off for a run.
Around middle and leg, smothered to the leg side.
Around off, pushed to the off side.
Outside off, punched through covers for a run. 5 runs and a wicket from the part-timer's over. Worth one more?
Around off, defended solidly.

OUT! CAUGHT! Would you believe it? The part-timer has broken the 64-run stand! Ohhh... Bangladesh are just beside themselves. A nothing delivery, and a nothing shot. Shanto flights this one, on middle and Janith Liyanage is down the track, just wanting to take the bowler on. But he is not quite to the pitch of the ball and still, goes through with his chip. Ends up hitting it straight to wide long on where Tanzim Hasan Sakib takes a dolly. Liyanage is distraught and trudges back, departing for 29 (40). Sri Lanka are 153/5 after 31.4 overs!
Janith Liyanage c TH Sakib b NH Shanto 29 (40b 4x4 0x6)
Full, on middle and leg, Liyanage looks to flick but misses and is hit on the pads. Seemed like an inside edge involved.
Full, around off, pushed back to the bowler.
FOUR! Short and wide to start, outside off, Janith Liyanage rocks back and cuts it behind point for a boundary!
Outside off, driven through mid off for a run.
A short ball, pulled through long leg for a single.

SAVED BY A HAIR'S BREADTH! But some real casual cricket by the Lankan skipper. On a length, outside off, Liyanage punched it towards mid off. He took off for a quick single and his skipper responded but while running, did not feel to drag his bat in. There was a direct hit scored by the fielder, at the striker's end and Litton was happy. The run out appeal was referred upstairs and replay shows that Asalanka plonked his bat in! Luckily for him, it hit the ground before the ball could hit the stumps.
Full and around middle and leg, Liyanage falls over a little bit but manages to connect with the ball and flicks it towards short mid-wicket.
WIDE. A short ball, down the leg side, Janith Liyanage gets inside the line and looks to pull but misses.
Fuller now, pushed down towards mid on.
On a length, around off, pushed down to long on for a single.
Quicker one, full and on off, Charith Asalanka drills it to sweeper covers for one more.
Slightly shorter in length, on middle, Charith Asalanka moves back and punches it to extra covers.
Floated, full and around off, Charith Asalanka pushes it towards covers.
Goes short again and on middle, angling in, Janith Liyanage works it through mid-wicket for a single.

FOUR! Good effort in the deep, but it goes in vain! Flighted, full and around leg. Janith Liyanage advances down the track to get close to the pitch of the ball and whips it away. The fielder from deep square leg runs a long way to his left and dives but fails to stop the boundary. That also brings up the 50-RUN STAND between these two batters.
Shorter in length and on middle, Janith Liyanage stays back and clips it to short mid-wicket.
Change of pace, fullish and on off, Charith Asalanka just pushes it back towards the bowler. Just 12 runs in the last 3 overs!
Pulls his length back now a bit, on middle, Charith Asalanka stays in his crease and pats it towards short mid-wicket.

FOUR! Up and over! A boundary after 20 balls! Pitched up and well outside off. Charith Asalanka decides to go after it. He extends his arms to reach out for it and lofts it over extra covers for four runs.
On a length and on off again, Charith Asalanka pats it towards cover-point and takes a step forward. JL wants the run, but Asalanka sends him back.
Good fielding! Touch fuller this time, on off, Charith Asalanka drives it firmly, but the fielder at short covers dives to his right to make a fine stop.
Mustafizur Rahman comes 'over the wicket and lands this on a good length, on off. Charith Asalanka gets behind the line of it and blocks it down the pitch.
Flighted, full and around off, Charith Asalanka gets forward and drives it through covers for one more. Four singles in this over as well.
A bit shor and on middle and leg, Janith Liyanage clips it off the back foot towards mid-wicket for one.
Floated, full and on middle, Janith Liyanage goes down and swipes it to sqaure leg.

Run out chance...missed! Mehidy Hasan Miraz drags his length back again, on off, Charith Asalanka steers it towards point and sets off for the run. Tawhid Hridoy is quick to collect the ball and has a shy at the bowler's end. Asalanka is not expecting the throw at his end and slows down a bit. He has to put in a dive, but luckily for him, the ball goes past the stumps, otherwise, he would have been a goner.
Short again and on off, Charith Asalanka backs away and bit and punches it to coevrs.
Shorter in length and around leg, Janith Liyanage moves back and flicks it through backward square leg for a single.
Gives this one some more air around off, Janith Liyanage strides out and pushes it through covers for one more.
Slows it up, full and around off, Janith Liyanage defends it on the front foot.
Flatter, full and on off again, Charith Asalanka drives it to long off for another run.
Flighted, full and on off, Charith Asalanka knocks it to the left of the bowler. Tanvir Islam dives to that side to stop the run. Najmul Hossain Shanto is trying to help Tanvir loosen up his muscles.
Floated, full and on off, Janith Liyanage gets to the pitch of it and drills it to long off for a run. Tanvir Islam is clearly struggling with cramps here.
Tossed up, full and on middle and off, Charith Asalanka steps across and flicks it through square leg for a single.
Nails the yorker right this time, on middle, angles in, Janith Liyanage gets his bat down in time to dig it out. 7 runs off the over!
Takes pace off now, back of a length and around off, Charith Asalanka punches it through covers for another run.
Pitched up and on off, Charith Asalanka strides out and taps it to the off side.
Hard length and on the sixth stump line, Janith Liyanage uses the pace and runs it down to deep third for a run.
On a length and around leg, Charith Asalanka nudges it towards short fine for a single.
FOUR! Easy pickings! Short of a length and well outside off, Charith Asalanka gets the chance to free his arms and crunches it over point for a boundary.

FIFTY FOR ASALANKA! 16th ODI half century, in just 61 balls and this has been a captain's knock from him. Tanvir Islam drags his length back and around off, Charith Asalanka steers it towards point for a single.
Floated, short and middle, turns in, Charith Asalanka tucks it to short mid-wicket.
Flatter, full and on middle and leg, Janith Liyanage uses his feet and drills it to mid on for a quick run.
Around off, Liyanage gets a big stride in front to defend.

FOUR! That's clever. Full, outside off, Janith Liyanage plays that on the line. Gets across his stumps and picks the ball up, and using the pace of the bowler, laps it through fine leg. Taskin Ahmed is stationed at deep backward square leg but given that he has just bowled an over, gives up the chase pretty early.
Landed outside off, a touch short, Charith Asalanka punches it through the covers for a single.
Hard length and around off, Janith Liyanage punches it to covers.

Tough outing for Mehidy Hasan Miraz as skipper. One review lost due to Najmul Hossain Shanto and the second one lost due to his keeper and bowler. Cannot blame the keeper here as he could not have seen wood from his angle. This is on a good length and around middle, angling in sharply. Janith Liyanage tried to play at it from the crease, but his bat got stuck behind the pads and the ball hit him on the pads. Initially, it looked like the ball hit his pad first and Taskin is very sure of that. The keeper is more interested in the impact but Ahmed says that the batter was well in line of the stumps. After much deliberation, Mehidy takes the DRS. However, the replay and UltraEdge confirm that it is indeed bat first. Both reviews exhausted by Bangladesh!
Fuller and on middle, angling in, Janith Liyanage tucks it to short mid-wicket.
Another short ball, down the leg side, this time Asalanka swivels and pulls it through square leg for a single.
A short ball now, nudged to the leg side.

SIX! FEROCIOUS! Welcome back, mate! That's two sixes in the last 3 balls of the Taskin vs Asalanka contest. Tasking comes running in and bowls a loosener, gently rolling his fingers over the ball and floating it around middle and leg, Charith Asalanka picks the slower ball and is ready. Swings it massively over deep mid-wicket, for his third six!
Another short delivery, on middle, Charith Asalanka pats it past the bowler and towards mid on for one.
Drags his length back, does Tanvir, on off, Janith Liyanage pats it towards covers and sets off for the single. There is a chance to hurry the batters, but the fielder fails to pick it up cleanly.
Good stop! Tossed up, full and on off, Janith Liyanage drives it wide of short covers where the fielder dives to his left to stop it well.
The arm ball, outside off, punched towards point.
Slower through the air, around middle, Liyanage defends.
A short ball, outside off, Janith Liyanage punches it towards point. Seems like Tanvir Islam is cramping up!
FOUR! Nicely done! Flatter, short and just outside off. Charith Asalanka lets it come to him, opens the face of the bat and steers it late and past short third for a boundary. 100 UP FOR LANKA!
Floated, full and on middle, Janith Liyanage works it towards long on for one.

Goes short and on middle, Janith Liyanage stays back and pats it towards mid-wicket. Asalanka wants the run but is sent back, and the fielder scores a direct hit at the bowler's end. The onfield umpire refers the run out appeal upstairs. However, the replay shows that the Lankan skipper has put his bat inside in time.

Good running, good understanding. Charith taps it with soft hands on the front foot through cover-point and takes off for the single after getting a call from his partner. Does not even look where the ball is, showing his commitment on the call and makes the other end.
Slower through the air, around middle, Asalanka stays leg side of the ball and pushes it towards cover.
Full, around middle and off, Charith Asalanka lunges and pushes the ball away.
Arm ball, full and on middle, angling in, Janith Liyanage strides out to defend but gets an inside edge to the right of the bowler.
Flighted, full and around leg, Janith Liyanage uses his feet and drills it away wide of mid on for a brace.
Tossed up, full and on off, turns away, Janith Liyanage prods forward and keeps it out to the off side.
Outside off, Janith Liyanage lunges to defend but the ball pitches and turns, to take the outside edge. But it lands well short of first slip and rolls away to his right, to short third.
Full, around off, Charith Asalanka looks to sweep but gets a bottom edge through short third. A single taken.
Full, on middle, worked to the leg side.
FOUR! Off the mark in good fashion. A bit too straight, overpitched as well, Liyanage gets across and works this through mid-wicket for a boundary.
Full, outside off, Janith Liyanage leans and drives it towards mid off.
A length ball, around off, kept out.
A touch short now, defended from the crease.
Outside off, pushed through the covers for a single.
On a good length, on middle, worked to the leg side.

OUT! LBW! The review is retained by Sri Lanka but Kusal Mendis has to go. Tanvir Islam gets his maiden ODI wicket and the 60-run stand has been broken. Beautifully thought about by the left-arm spinner. The previous ball was flighted and there was turn. But this one was delivered with the arm and there was a bit of drift into the right hander, from around the wicket. Mendis looked to defend but missed and was hit on the pads. This time, there was a bigger appeal, for LBW and the umpire raised his finger. Mendis had a long look at his stride and then had a chat with Asalanka. Signaled for the 'T'. UltraEdge detects nothing when ball is near the bat while Ball Tracking shows the ball to be clipping the outer half of leg stump, which returns an umpire's call. Unfortunate for Mendis, as he has to depart for a fantastic 45 (43). Sri Lanka are 89/4 after 19 overs!
Kusal Mendis (wk) lbw T Islam 45 (43b 6x4 1x6)

Whoa, what a ball. There is an appeal made for caught behind, but more than the keeper or the bowler, Najmul Hossain Shanto at first slip seemed to be the most excited, as he straightaway ran towards the bowler in celebration! Full, outside off, Mendis lunges to defend but the ball pitches and then whizzes past the outside edge. Bangladesh appeal but the umpire stays mum. Shanto is into the ears of Litton Das, the keeper and eventually, Mehidy is convinced that the review needs to be taken. However, UltraEdge detects a flat line when the ball is near the bat! Review lost for Bangladesh.

Nicely done. Flighted, outside off, Kusal Mendis stays leg side of the ball and lofts it nicely over cover. Jaker Ali covers good ground to his left from long off and does well to get to the ball and stop it. Two runs taken.
Outside off, dabbed towards point for one.
Full, outside off, driven through mid off for a run.
Down the leg side, tucked through square leg for a single.
On a good length, around middle and leg, CA tucks it through square leg for a run.
A length ball, drifting down leg, the bowler is lucky to get away with that as Asalanka works it straight to short mid-wicket.
Back of a length, outside off, Kusal Mendis punches it through the covers for one.
Landed on a length, outside off, steered behind point for a run. Moves to 30 (42).
Full, on middle, flicked straight to short mid-wicket.
On a length, outside off, stabbed to deep third for a single.
Outside off, pushed through mid off for a run. Decent start by the debutant.

50-STAND UP IN 64 BALLS! Excellent recovery. Full, on middle, the skipper comes forward to drive but the ball holds on the surface a touch. Hence, he ends up checking his shot and spoons it a bit, but it is well wide of the bowler, through mid on, for a single.
Shouts for LBW, turned down. Full, outside off, CA gets a big stride outside off and looks to sweep but misses and is hit on the pads. The keeper appeals but the impact was clearly way outside off.
Full, on middle and leg, Charith stabs it to the leg side.
Around off, no pace offered. Asalanka looks to push and run through the off side but is sent back.
Full, just around middle, Charith Asalanka looks to defend but gets a thick inside edge onto his pads.
WIDE. But the debutant gets grip and turn on his very first delivery. On middle and leg, the ball pitches and goes past the flick, down the leg side.
FOUR! Poor ball and put away. Short, around middle, from around the wicket, going away with the angle, Kusal Mendis rocks back and drags the pull through mid-wicket, for a boundary!
Fractionally short in length, outside off, Charith goes back and punches it through the covers for a single.
Full and around off, Asalanka defends watchfully.

Just shimmies down the wicket a touch and on seeing that, Mehidy fires it in. Mendis adjusts and just pushes it back defensively. Short mid-wicket gets across to his left and dives but cannot stop the ball. A single taken to long on.
The arm ball, around off, Charith Asalanka pushes it through the covers for a run.
Full, around off, Kusal Mendis leans and pushes it through mid on for a single.
The Fizz pulls his length back a bit, on off, shapes the ball in, Charith Asalanka stays back and blocks it out nicely.
Touch fuller and on off, Kusal Mendis pushes it with soft hands through cover-point for a run.
Good length and around off, Charith Asalanka opens the face of his bat and guides it to deep third for a single. Good batting!
FOUR! Straight as an arrow! Overpitched and on middle, Charith Asalanka brings out the full face of the bat and executes the straight drive beautfully past the bowler, through mid on, for a boundary.
On a length and on off, Charith Asalanka stabs it out towards cover-point.
Fuller in length, on middle, angling in, Charith Asalanka gets behind the line of it and blocks it out.
FOUR! Nice use of the feet! Gives this one some more air, full and on off. Kusal Mendis skips down the track to get to the pitch of it and lofts it well over and wide of mid off for a boundary.
Quicker one, full and on off, Charith Asalanka drills it to long off for another run.
Loops it up, full and on middle, Kusal Mendis clips it through mid-wicket for a run.
Flighted, full and on off, Charith Asalanka strides out and eases it to long off for a single.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Charith Asalanka pushes it back to the bowler.
Floated, full and on off, Charith Asalanka steers it to the off side.

Half an appeal for caught behind, but turned down! Mustafizur Rahman bowls the wide yorker, outside off. Kusal Mendis tries to squeeze it away but hits his bat on the ground, The ball goes through to the keeper. Bangladesh opts against the review as the noise was from the bat hitting the ground. A MAIDEN for the Fizz!
Hard length and outside off, angling away, Kusal Mendis thinks about cutting it away but lets it go in the end.

Clever bowling! Mustafizur Rahman bowls the off cutter, on a length and on off, grips in the surface and moves away. Kusal Mendis tries to guide it away but gets deceived by the lack of pace. The ball takes the outside edge but goes on the bounce to the keeper.
Back of a length and on off, Kusal Mendis dabs it to point.
On a length and on off, Kusal Mendis pats it towards covers and calls for the run but is sent back. He takes his time to turn back, and the fielder misses his shy at the batter's end. No harm done.
Fuller in length, on off, angling away, Kusal Mendis drives it firmly but straight to point.
Drags his length back, on middle, Kusal Mendis punches it to long on for a run.
Pushed through quicker, full and on middle, Kusal Mendis strides out and blocks it out.
Flighted, full and on off, CA drives it to long off for a single.
Flatter delivery, full and around off, Charith Asalanka goes down across to sweep but misses and gets hit on the pads. A slight appeal for LBW, but turned down. Clearly impact is outside off there.
Floated, short and on off, angling in, Charith Asalanka moves back to play at it but gets an iniside edge onto hos boots as the ball rolls down the pitch.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Charith Asalanka pushes it to short covers.

FOUR! Put away! Mustafizur bangs this into the surface but bounces only as high as the waist of the batter, on off. Mendis pounces on it quickly and pulls it in front of square on the leg side for a boundary.
Mustafizur Rahman hits the length hard, on off, Kusal Mendis just keeps it out to the off side.
Short of a length and around off, Kusal Mendis lets it come to him and punches hard but finds point, Four dots in row!
Touch fuller this time, on the fifth stump line, Kusal Mendis stays back and blocks it out.
On a length and on off, Kusal Mendis steers it to the left of point and straightaway denies the single.
Play and a miss! Back of a length and outside off, angling further away, Kusal Mendis throws his bat at it but fails to connect.

Drags his length back, on middle, Charith Asalanka stays back and pats it to short covers. 8 runs from the first over of spin. 50/3 at the end of Powerplay 1, which is a decent score in terms of the runs but Bangladesh would be equally happy with the wickets. The first half went for just 15 runs, but the Lankans managed to score freely in the next half.
Floated, full and on middle, Charith Asalanka defends it on the front foot.
Goes short and around off, Kusal Mendis moves back and punches it wide of mid off for a run. 50 up for Sri Lanka!
Good cricket. Taking a single after the boundary. Down the leg side, Charith stays back and nudges it on the leg side behind the wickets. Takes a quick single.

SIX! CREAMED! He is not going to hang around, Asalanka, is he? Saw off one ball from the spinner and that's enough for him. Full, around middle and off, looped up again, Asalanka gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps it massively over mid-wicket!
Flight straightaway, landing on a length just short of full, around off, Charith Asalanka defends watchfully.
Pitched up but on the pads, Charith Asalanka flicks it away towards deep square leg for one.
SIX! Breaks the shackles now! Goes full and well outside off. Charith Asalanka extends his arms to reach out for it and dispatches it with ease over the wide long off fence for a biggie.
On a length and on leg, Charith Asalanka tucks it towards short mid-wicket.
Full and straight, Charith Asalanka defends watchfully.

And now, the outside edge is found. But it goes to ground. On a length, outside off, Mendis comes half forward to defend but the ball pitches and moves away, squaring him up. He tries to play with soft hands but is still late, getting an outside edge, which goes on the bounce to the right of first slip, towards deep third. A single taken.
Beaten. Full, outside off, Kusal Mendis leans to drive but the ball holds on the pitch a touch, arrives late and then bounces extra. Mendis tries to bail out of the shot but is late and gets beaten.
Back of a length and around off, Charith Asalanka dabs it to point.

FOUR! Lovely shot! Mustafizur Rahman goes a bit too full this time, on middle. Charith Asalanka presents the full face of the bat and drives it gloriously down the ground to the long on fence for a boundary.

Beaten! Short of a length and just on off, angles in a bit. Charith Asalanka looks to cut it away, but this is too close to his body for that shot. It goes past the outside edge and just about carries to the keeper.
Full, around off, Asalanka defends watchfully.
On a length again, outside off, Charith Asalanka looks to cut but mistimes it back to the bowler.
On a length, outside off, Kusal Mendis punches it through point for a single.
MAIDEN-WICKET OVER! On a length and on middle and off, Charith Asalanka blocks it out solidly.
Again, no feet movement! Taskin Ahmed serves this full and outside off, Charith Asalanka stays in his crease, reaches out and drills it to covers. Five dots, including the wicket now.
Slightly back of a length and on off, Charith Asalanka stays back and punches it to covers.
Fuller, around off, pushed back defensively.
On a good length, around middle and off, defended solidly.

OUT! CAUGHT! Another batter dismissed while trying to play on the up. Honestly, very surprised to see the choice of shot played by Kamindu Mendis. ​Normally, he is very patient and likes to build his innings but perhaps, the situation and some inconsistent form over the past few months got to him. However, logically speaking, Taskin may not bowl again for a while beyond this over or at the most, beyond the 9th over. So, Kamindu could have seen him off. But he gets a length ball around off and he thinks that he can go over the top. Tries to drive it on the up over mid off but there is no footwork and he can only get it as far as mid off. Skipper Mehidy Hasan Miraz gets across to his left from mid off and leaps to take the catch. Kamindu departs for a 4-ball duck and Sri Lanka are 29/3 after 6.1 overs!
Kamindu Mendis c MH Miraz b T Ahmed 0 (4b 0x4 0x6)
On a length and around leg, Kusal Mendis nudges it to short mid-wicket. 14 runs off the over!

SIX! BANG! Kusal Mendis goes big now! Tanzim Hasan Sakib bangs this one into the pitch to test the batter, but this one sits up nicely, on middle. Mendis picks it up quickly, swivels, and heaves it over the deep square leg fence for the first six of the match!
Goes a bit fuller again, on middle, angling in, Kusal Mendis steps across and clips it to short mid-wicket.
Back of a length now, outside off, punched towards cover.
FOUR MORE! He is looking better and better now, Kusal. Just short of full, outside off, Kusal comes forward and drives it on the up, between cover and mid off, for successive boundaries.
FOUR! Too straight and punished. Half volley, on middle and leg, Kusal Mendis whips it through mid-wicket for a boundary.
On middle and leg, worked towards short mid-wicket. 6 runs and a wicket from the over, 10/2 in the last 2 overs.

FOUR LEG BYES! A rare bad ball from Taskin and he is annoyed with himself. On a length, but down the leg side. Kamindu Mendis looks to tuck it away but misses. However, the ball goes off his pads through fine leg to the ropes.
On a length, outside off, angling away, left alone.

OUT! CHOPPED ON, BOWLED! Well, perhaps Madushka should not have called for that single on the previous ball! Both the Lankan openers are back in the hut, in the span of 9 balls. On a good length, outside off, Nishan Madushka looks to drive it on the up through the off side but his feet move nowhere. The ball comes in with the angle, cramps him for room and goes off the inside edge onto the stumps. Madushka stands there looking at his bat but has to depart eventually, for 6 (13). Sri Lanka are 11/2 after 4.3 overs!
Nishan Madushka b T Ahmed 6 (13b 1x4 0x6)

Good running. Full, outside off, Kusal Mendis puts in a good reach and makes a defensive push to the left of mid off. Nishan Madushka is quick to call for the single and the batters make it with ease. Normally, whenever the ball is behind the non-striker, it is the call of the striker but no harm done here.

Another streaky run. On a good length, outside off, Nishan Madushka pushes at this coming half forward but the ball nips back in a touch and goes off the inner half of the bat, through fine leg. A single taken.
Outside off, left alone. 4 runs and a wicket from that over.

FOUR! Fine shot to get off the mark. Perhaps Tanzim wants to alter his length and tries to check the footwork of the batter by banging it short. But this barely rises above the waist and Mendis swivels quickly, gets on top of the bounce and pulls it over square leg for a boundary.
Perfect line and length, around off, just short of full, Kusal Mendis defends.
Full again, pushed towards mid on.
Full and straight, defended solidly.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! He was looking uncomfortable in his short stay and Tanzim has relieved him of his misery. Back of a length, outside off, Pathum Nissanka looks to punch it through the off side but the ball nips back in slightly and also, bounces a shade extra. Nissanka is cramped for room and hence, gets a thick outside edge. The ball flies behind but the keeper, Litton Das, leaps to his right and takes it with one glove, in front of first slip. The in-form batter departs for an 8-baller and Sri Lanka are 5/1 after 3.1 overs!
Pathum Nissanka c L Das b TH Sakib 0 (8b 0x4 0x6)
Full, around off, Nishan comes forward to drive but cannot beat cover.

That is a jaffa. On a good length, outside off, Madushka looks to defend but the ball pitches and then seams back in sharply, bouncing high as well, cutting the batter into half. Beats the inside edge, the pad and even the top of off stump.
On a good length, outside off, good bounce, NM rises with the bounce and pushes it towards point.
Around off, coming in, Nishan looks to defend but gets a thick inside edge towards mid-wicket.
FOUR! Up and over! Just a touch short this time and Madushka is back in a flash. Picks the length quickly and then punches it over cover for the first boundary of the match.
On a good length, outside off, Nishan Madushka comes forward for the defense but the ball beats the outside edge.
Full and straight, coming in with the angle, Pathum Nissanka works it towards short mid-wicket.

Finally, on the 11th ball of the match, Sri Lanka open their account! On a good length, outside off, Nishan Madushka waits for the ball to arrive and at the last moment, opens the face of his bat to guide the ball behind point for a single.
Still can't get it through! On a length, outside off, NM looks to punch it between cover and point but the fielder from cover gets across to his left and stops the ball!
Fuller in length, outside off, Nishan drives it towards cover.
Back of a length now, outside off, Madushka looks to punch but gets a bottom edge onto the pitch.
On a good length, outside off, Nishan Madushka rises with the bounce and punches it towards cover.
A MAIDEN to start! On a length, outside off, Nissanka pushes it straight to cover.
Full and just outside off, moving away slightly, Pathum Nissanka looks to defend but the ball pitches and moves away off the seam, to catch the outside edge. Rolls all along the ground towards point.
This one jags back in of a length, PN looks to defend but gets a thick inside edge onto his pads.
Better line. On a good length, just outside off, Pathum looks to play for the angle, which is making the ball come in. But after pitching, the ball straightens to beat the outside edge.
A touch short, outside off, Nissanka slashes hard but misses.
On a length, outside off, Pathum Nissanka lets it go. The pitch is already looking slow. That took ages to reach the keeper.
